intro: Tzveleviochloa, commonly known as the slender panicgrass, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The flowers are typically arranged in spikelets, which are clustered in panicles, a common feature among grasses. Tzveleviochloa species are often found in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. These plants are generally low-growing and are sometimes used in ecological restoration projects due to their adaptability and resilience.
